Name: Bamako
Description: Bamako is the capital and largest city of Mali. It serves as the administrative, cultural, and economic hub of the country.

Name: Kayes
Description: Kayes is the westernmost region of Mali, known for its gold mines and agricultural production, especially cotton and millet.

Name: Ségou
Description: Ségou is located in the central part of Mali, recognized for its historical significance and the Niger River passing through it.

Name: Koulikoro
Description: Koulikoro is located in the western part of Mali and plays an important role in the transportation and agricultural sectors.

Name: Tombouctou
Description: Tombouctou (Timbuktu) is famous for its historical significance as a center of learning and trade, particularly during the medieval period.

Name: Gao
Description: Gao is located in the northern part of Mali and is known for its desert landscapes and historical trading posts.

Name: Kidal
Description: Kidal is in the northeastern part of Mali and is known for its desert terrain, nomadic Tuareg culture, and political significance.

Name: Mopti
Description: Mopti is in central Mali and serves as a trade and transportation hub, known for its proximity to the Niger River and its diverse ethnic communities.

Name: Sikasso
Description: Sikasso is the southernmost region of Mali, known for its fertile lands, agriculture (especially cotton), and vibrant local markets.
